Ok im seeing what we did to women. Its not great. They suffered among the rich and famous but only in that they did not get the money or credit. It is very difficult and pointless realy but i feel it should be done to extract information about that time to find out who got treated worse. Its seems pretty obviously though every one got it bad in the low classes. And as you look at mid tier families the gap between men and women widen and at their peak the gap is so large in the higjer classes they can be equals in the field to men but be no more then assistants. We tend to look at and concentrate on high profile cases. All i ask is people keep there fields of data collection wide. One doesnt just look at women rights violations to determine if one side is treated better then the other. You look at both thats what it meams to be a researcher. You seek the truth and only the truth. Equivalently the men had it better in a very general sense but women werent digging underground for coal because there lack of strength saved them from that fate. Because of that lack of strength they were given horrible easy tasks, boring tasks. Tasks that took immense concentration for very little pay off. Lace was very expensive back in the day but takes a long time to make. They werent given any bonuses for the gender they were born with but there female limitations were a boon. Not in the case of the radium girls. Fine motor control was not ideal if it meant you were the best for the job of using radioactive paints. So realy women saved themselves. Or there biology did. And we did nothing. However like the women mens biology put them in the postion to lord over women. Now thats all in the past mostly. Enough that the gap is nothing compared to then so can we all agree that we fked up but we have tried so bloody hard to fix what some old twat did for thousands of years since humans first eveolved. Because thats certainly how far back this would go. Its what made us human. Now we have gone against all natural order to make it fair. Pls be happy with that. We all need to understand how massive this is. We owned the entire world and we stood at the top uncontested. Women didnt take that away from us. They wouldnt be able to. WE GAVE IT AWAY. WHAT YOU WANTED SO DESPERATELY WE GAVE IT TO YOU WILLINGLY.  So sit down and carry on with life happy with your equality like the rest of us. Dont take any more. We dont have anything left.

This is a really nice video, but it seems some people would like to play identity politics with these influential scientists. Even if they are women and people of color, are they not "great minds" first and foremost? So much for conservatives saying, "Race and gender doesn't matter! Stop talking about it!!!1!", but when people point out their vast contributions to society those same conservatives only want to focus on their race and gender. Its almost like people think white and male are the baseline, and everything else is like a character customization step. Of course there is nothing wrong with being white and male, but that shouldn't be seen as the norm for everyone.
Love your show. Please ... No more cockroaches
Never go full Scishow!
Marie Curie! Where is Marie Curie?

Turner: Insects are not simple machines responding to stimuli, they are rational desision makers that hold the same unique trait humans and bigger animals do!

Behaviouralists some decades later: Yeah, about that cognition thingy, we are pretty sure it's just a slightly more complex machine responding to stimuli. Thanks Turner!

All jokes aside, humans have learned so much by simply questioning our own bloated ego and the way we often underappreciate all other life on this planet. Saying other life is smart and saying we aren't as special as we think is just two sides of the same coin. Traditions throughout world have seen animals as wise teachers, aspirational heroes and force bigger and smarter than human throughout history. We should probably do that more often, and on the flip side, see ourselves more as animals than something divinely rased above simple rules of nature and life.

Now this is a nice compilation and all, but am I the only one who's thrown just a little bit off by the fact that these particular great minds are all women except for one black man? And the fact that that isn't mentioned once in the video?
Because it's clear as day to me that this is a celebration of diversity and that's super important considering how white-male-centered science has been in the past centuries, but to pretend that you came up with these particular people by pure chance just feels fake..
Maybe it's just me, Idk, but I'd have preferred if you had explained in the introduction why you chose who you chose, maybe even mention the struggles they had to face. The way you did it as a viewer i feel like you're just trying to appear progressive for your own sake and don't even really care about these scientists accomplishments or at least not as much as the fact that they were minorities.

Edit: so i went back to the whole playlist they have on great minds, turns out there only very few "white males" also they get even rarer with time (I believe in 2020 they didn't feature any). So maybe this was my misunderstanding and the whole series on great minds is supposed to bring attention to lesser known scientists who would in this case obviously be in prevalence ppl of colour and women. So, if that's the case why not making it more clear there's nothing wrong with it and not doing so can result in some confusion.
